core.component module

class core.component.Component(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Component defines all functional base classes such as Embedder, Retriever, Generator.

We purposly avoid using the name “Module” to avoid confusion with PyTorch’s nn.Module. As we consider ‘Component’ to be an extension to ‘Moduble’ as if you use a local llm model for the Generator, you might need the ‘Module’ within the ‘Component’.

But ‘Component’ follows a similar design pattern to ‘Module’ in PyTorch.

  1. ‘Module’ does not have async function because of GPU’s inherent parallelism.

But we need to support async functions. call and acall should call functions.

  1. All components can be running local or APIs. ‘Component’ can deal with API calls, so we need support retries and rate limits.

async acall(*args, **kwargs)[source]
add_component(name: str, component: Component | None) → None[source]
apply(fn: Callable[[Component, Any], None]) → None[source]

Applies a function to all subcomponents. # TODO: in what situation we need function apply?

call(*input: Any) → None

Define the call method for the component. Should be overriden by all subclasses.

children() → Iterable[Component][source]

Returns an iterator over immediate children modules.

components() → Iterable[Component][source]

Returns an iterator over all components in the Module.

extra_repr() → str[source]

Normally implemented by subcomponents to print additional positional or keyword arguments. # NOTE: Dont add components as it will have its own __repr__

get_subcomponent(name: str) → Component | None[source]
named_children() → Iterable[Tuple[str, Component]][source]

Returns an iterator over immediate children modules.
